column2: PART NINE
column3: PART NINE

column2: We have not written for many days.
column3: We have not written for many days.

column2: We did not wish to speak.
column3: We did not wish to speak.

column2: For we needed no words to remember that which has happened to us.
column3: For we needed no words to remember that which has happened to us.

column2: It was on our second day in the forest that we heard steps behind us.
column3: It was on our second day in the forest that we heard steps behind us.

column2: We hid in the bushes, and we waited.
column3: We hid in the bushes, and we waited.

column2: The steps came closer.
column3: The steps came closer.

column2: And then we saw the fold of a white tunic among the trees, and a gleam of gold.
column3: And then we saw the fold of a white tunic among the trees, and a gleam of gold.

column2: We leapt forward, we ran to them, and we stood looking upon the Golden One.
column3: We leapt forward, we ran to them, and we stood looking upon the Golden One.

column2: They saw us, and their hands closed into fists, and the fists pulled their arms down, as if they wished their arms to hold them, while their body swayed.
column3: They saw us, and their hands closed into fists, and the fists pulled their arms down, as if they wished their arms to hold them, while their body swayed.

column2: And they could not speak.
column3: And they could not speak.

column2: We dared not come too close to them.
column3: We dared not come too close to them.

column2: We asked, and our voice trembled:
column3: We asked, and our voice trembled:

column2: How did you come to be here, Golden One?
column3: How did you come to be here, Golden One?

column2: But they whispered only:
column3: But they whispered only:

column2: We have found you....
column3: We have found you....

column2: How did you come to be in the forest? we asked.
column3: How did you come to be in the forest? we asked.

column2: They raised their head, and there was a great pride in their voice; they answered:
column3: They raised their head, and there was a great pride in their voice; they answered:

column2: We have followed you.
column3: We have followed you.

column2: Then we could not speak, and they said:
column3: Then we could not speak, and they said:

column2: We heard that you had gone to the Uncharted Forest, for the whole City is speaking of it.	We heard that you had gone to the Uncharted Forest, for the whole City is speaking of it.
column3: true

column2: So on the night of the day when we heard it, we ran away from the Home of the Peasants.
column3: So on the night of the day when we heard it, we ran away from the Home of the Peasants.

column2: We found the marks of your feet across the plain where no men walk.
column3: We found the marks of your feet across the plain where no men walk.

column2: So we followed them, and we went into the forest, and we followed the path where the branches were broken by your body."
column3: So we followed them, and we went into the forest, and we followed the path where the branches were broken by your body."

column2: Their white tunic was torn, and the branches had cut the skin of their arms, but they spoke as if they had never taken notice of it, nor of weariness, nor of fear.
column3: Their white tunic was torn, and the branches had cut the skin of their arms, but they spoke as if they had never taken notice of it, nor of weariness, nor of fear.

column2: We have followed you, they said, "and we shall follow you wherever you go.
column3: We have followed you, they said, "and we shall follow you wherever you go.

column2: If danger threatens you, we shall face it also.
column3: If danger threatens you, we shall face it also.

column2: If it be death, we shall die with you.
column3: If it be death, we shall die with you.

column2: You are damned, and we wish to share your damnation."
column3: You are damned, and we wish to share your damnation."

column2: They looked upon us, and their voice was low, but there was bitterness and triumph in their voice.
column3: They looked upon us, and their voice was low, but there was bitterness and triumph in their voice.

column2: Your eyes are as a flame, but our brothers have neither hope nor fire. Your mouth is cut of granite, but our brothers are soft and humble.	Your eyes are as a flame, but our brothers have neither hope nor fire. Your mouth is cut of granite, but our brothers are soft and humble.
column3: true

column2: Your head is high, but our brothers cringe.
column3: Your head is high, but our brothers cringe.

column2: You walk, but our brothers crawl.
column3: You walk, but our brothers crawl.

column2: We wish to be damned with you, rather than blessed with all our brothers.
column3: We wish to be damned with you, rather than blessed with all our brothers.

column2: Do as you please with us, but do not send us away from you."
column3: Do as you please with us, but do not send us away from you."

column2: Then they knelt, and bowed their golden head before us.
column3: Then they knelt, and bowed their golden head before us.

column2: We had never thought of that which we did.
column3: We had never thought of that which we did.

column2: We bent to raise the Golden One to their feet, but when we touched them, it was as if madness had stricken us.
column3: We bent to raise the Golden One to their feet, but when we touched them, it was as if madness had stricken us.

column2: We seized their body and we pressed our lips to theirs.
column3: We seized their body and we pressed our lips to theirs.

column2: The Golden One breathed once, and their breath was a moan, and then their arms closed around us.
column3: The Golden One breathed once, and their breath was a moan, and then their arms closed around us.

column2: We stood together for a long time.
column3: We stood together for a long time.

column2: And we were frightened that we had lived for twenty-one years and had never known what joy is possible to men.
column3: And we were frightened that we had lived for twenty one years and had never known what joy is possible to men.

column2: Then we said:
column3: Then we said:

column2: Our dearest one.	Our dearest one.
column3: true

column2: Fear nothing of the forest.
column3: Fear nothing of the forest.

column2: There is no danger in solitude.
column3: There is no danger in solitude.

column2: We have no need of our brothers.
column3: We have no need of our brothers.

column2: Let us forget their good and our evil, let us forget all things save that we are together and that there is joy as a bond between us.
column3: Let us forget their good and our evil, let us forget all things save that we are together and that there is joy as a bond between us.

column2: Give us your hand.
column3: Give us your hand.

column2: Look ahead.
column3: Look ahead.

column2: It is our own world, Golden One, a strange, unknown world, but our own."
column3: It is our own world, Golden One, a strange, unknown world, but our own."

column2: Then we walked on into the forest, their hand in ours.
column3: Then we walked on into the forest, their hand in ours.

column2: And that night we knew that to hold the body of women in our arms is neither ugly nor shameful, but the one ecstasy granted to the race of men.
column3: And that night we knew that to hold the body of women in our arms is neither ugly nor shameful, but the one ecstasy granted to the race of men.

column2: We have walked for many days.
column3: We have walked for many days.

column2: The forest has no end, and we seek no end. But each day added to the chain of days between us and the City is like an added blessing.
column3: The forest has no end, and we seek no end. But each day added to the chain of days between us and the City is like an added blessing.

column2: We have made a bow and many arrows.
column3: We have made a bow and many arrows.

column2: We can kill more birds than we need for our food; we find water and fruit in the forest.
column3: We can kill more birds than we need for our food; we find water and fruit in the forest.

column2: At night, we choose a clearing, and we build a ring of fires around it.
column3: At night, we choose a clearing, and we build a ring of fires around it.

column2: We sleep in the midst of that ring, and the beasts dare not attack us.
column3: We sleep in the midst of that ring, and the beasts dare not attack us.

column2: We can see their eyes, green and yellow as coals, watching us from the tree branches beyond.
column3: We can see their eyes, green and yellow as coals, watching us from the tree branches beyond.

column2: The fires smoulder as a crown of jewels around us, and smoke stands still in the air, in columns made blue by the moonlight.
column3: The fires smoulder as a crown of jewels around us, and smoke stands still in the air, in columns made blue by the moonlight.

column2: We sleep together in the midst of the ring, the arms of the Golden One around us, their head upon our breast.
column3: We sleep together in the midst of the ring, the arms of the Golden One around us, their head upon our breast.

column2: Some day, we shall stop and build a house, when we shall have gone far enough.
column3: Some day, we shall stop and build a house, when we shall have gone far enough.

column2: But we do not have to hasten.
column3: But we do not have to hasten.

column2: The days before us are without end, like the forest.
column3: The days before us are without end, like the forest.

column2: We cannot understand this new life which we have found, yet it seems so clear and so simple.
column3: We cannot understand this new life which we have found, yet it seems so clear and so simple.

column2: When questions come to puzzle us, we walk faster, then turn and forget all things as we watch the Golden One following. The shadows of leaves fall upon their arms, as they spread the branches apart, but their shoulders are in the sun.
column3: When questions come to puzzle us, we walk faster, then turn and forget all things as we watch the Golden One following. The shadows of leaves fall upon their arms, as they spread the branches apart, but their shoulders are in the sun

column2: The skin of their arms is like a blue mist, but their shoulders are white and glowing, as if the light fell not from above, but rose from under their skin.
column3: The skin of their arms is like a blue mist, but their shoulders are white and glowing, as if the light fell not from above, but rose from under their skin.

column2: We watch the leaf which has fallen upon their shoulder, and it lies at the curve of their neck, and a drop of dew glistens upon it like a jewel.
column3: We watch the leaf which has fallen upon their shoulder, and it lies at the curve of their neck, and a drop of dew glistens upon it like a jewel.

column2: They approach us, and they stop, laughing, knowing what we think, and they wait obediently, without questions, till it pleases us to turn and go on.
column3: They approach us, and they stop, laughing, knowing what we think, and they wait obediently, without questions, till it pleases us to turn and go on.

column2: We go on and we bless the earth under our feet.
column3: We go on and we bless the earth under our feet.

column2: But questions come to us again, as we walk in silence.
column3: But questions come to us again, as we walk in silence.

column2: If that which we have found is the corruption of solitude, then what can men wish for save corruption?
column3: If that which we have found is the corruption of solitude, then what can men wish for save corruption?

column2: If this is the great evil of being alone, then what is good and what is evil?
column3: If this is the great evil of being alone, then what is good and what is evil?

column2: Everything which comes from the many is good.
column3: Everything which comes from the many is good.

column2: Everything which comes from one is evil.
column3: Everything which comes from one is evil.

column2: This have we been taught with our first breath.
column3: This have we been taught with our first breath.

column2: We have broken the law, but we have never doubted it.
column3: We have broken the law, but we have never doubted it.

column2: Yet now, as we walk through the forest, we are learning to doubt.
column3: Yet now, as we walk through the forest, we are learning to doubt.

column2: There is no life for men, save in useful toil for the good of all their brothers.
column3: There is no life for men, save in useful toil for the good of all their brothers.

column2: But we lived not, when we toiled for our brothers, we were only weary.
column3: But we lived not, when we toiled for our brothers, we were only weary.

column2: There is no joy for men, save the joy shared with all their brothers.
column3: There is no joy for men, save the joy shared with all their brothers.

column2: But the only things which taught us joy were the power we created in our wires, and the Golden One.
column3: But the only things which taught us joy were the power we created in our wires, and the Golden One.

column2: And both these joys belong to us alone, they come from us alone, they bear no relation to all our brothers, and they do not concern our brothers in any way.
column3: And both these joys belong to us alone, they come from us alone, they bear no relation to all our brothers, and they do not concern our brothers in any way.

column2: Thus do we wonder.
column3: Thus do we wonder.

column2: There is some error, one frightful error, in the thinking of men.
column3: There is some error, one frightful error, in the thinking of men.

column2: What is that error?
column3: What is that error?

column2: We do not know, but the knowledge struggles within us, struggles to be born.
column3: We do not know, but the knowledge struggles within us, struggles to be born.

column2: Today, the Golden One stopped suddenly and said:
column3: Today, the Golden One stopped suddenly and said:

column2: We love you.
column3: We love you.

column2: But they frowned and shook their head and looked at us helplessly.
column3: But they frowned and shook their head and looked at us helplessly.

column2: No, they whispered, "that is not what we wished to say."
column3: No, they whispered, "that is not what we wished to say."

column2: They were silent, then they spoke slowly, and their words were halting, like the words of a child learning to speak for the first time:
column3: They were silent, then they spoke slowly, and their words were halting, like the words of a child learning to speak for the first time:

column2: We are one... alone... and only... and we love you who are one... alone... and only.
column3: We are one... alone... and only... and we love you who are one... alone... and only.

column2: We looked into each other's eyes and we knew that the breath of a miracle had touched us, and fled, and left us groping vainly.
column3: We looked into each other's eyes and we knew that the breath of a miracle had touched us, and fled, and left us groping vainly.

column2: And we felt torn, torn for some word we could not find.
column3: And we felt torn, torn for some word we could not find.

column2: PART TEN
column3: PART TEN

column2: We are sitting at a table and we are writing this upon paper made thousands of years ago.
column3: We are sitting at a table and we are writing this upon paper made thousands of years ago.

column2: The light is dim, and we cannot see the Golden One, only one lock of gold on the pillow of an ancient bed.
column3: The light is dim, and we cannot see the Golden One, only one lock of gold on the pillow of an ancient bed.

column2: This is our home.
column3: This is our home.
